Executives of the two companies, which will formally close the sale Nov. 1, refused to say how many employees might be dismissed as a result of the takeover.

title: Questionable Priorities
description: To the Editor:

title: UST Makes Public a Deal To Buy Walden Bancorp
description: The UST Corporation said today that it would buy Walden Bancorp Inc. of Acton, Mass., for $155.9 million in stock and take a $13.5 million pretax charge in a move to increase its presence in eastern Massachusetts.

title: Not Just Any Crazy Old Man: A King
description: The old man with the biblical beard and the gold lame outfit was obviously upset, to put it mildly. He was railing against his family, himself and the universe in a voice that thundered over the moan of traffic around Washington Square.

title: Fight Over Closing Law
description: A new law designed to cut down on nocturnal noise sets mandatory closing times for nearly all businesses. But Benjamin Joo, the president of the local Korean-American Chamber of Commerce, said the new ordinance was aimed at driving away the town's three karaoke clubs, which do not serve food or alcohol but stay open late. The Borough Council allowed one diner to remain open all night, but did not extend the same exemption to the half-dozen 24-hour Korean restaurants, which must now close at 3 A.M., Mr. Joo said.

title: Sex, Drugs And Dole
description: Is it true that Dick Morris shared the First Lady's and the Vice President's convention speeches with a prostitute days before they were delivered to the public? If so, let history note that this is the first recorded instance of the official oratory of either Hillary Clinton or Al Gore being used as an aphrodisiac.

title: Bond Prices Fall Again on Fears of Fed Move
description: Prices of Treasury securities continued Thursday's retreat yesterday as more economic evidence suggested that the economy was not slowing as much as many investors had hoped, making a Federal Reserve move to push up interest rates increasingly likely.

title: COMPANY BRIEFS
description: PATRIOT AMERICAN HOSPITALITY INC., Dallas, completed the purchase of the Valley River Inn in Eugene, Ore., for $18.8 million from Valley River Inn L.P., a private investment group.

title: Tokyo Stocks at 5-Month Low, Reflecting Worries Over Growth
description: Japan's benchmark stock index plunged to its lowest level in five months today, led by declines in shares of car and steel makers, reflecting concern that Japan's economic growth has stalled.

title: Executive Changes
description: AMERICAN EXPRESS CO., New York, said Walter Berman, its treasurer and the chief financial officer of its travel services unit, had resigned to start his own consulting practice.

title: Hope and Dismay in a Catholic Survey
description: Because the survival of any religious institution depends on the generation that follows those now in charge, churches and synagogues have a natural interest in knowing the feelings of their young people toward the faith.

title: Strings Flirting With Drones and Dance Rhythms
description: Of all the string traditions that she could draw from, Diedre Murray, an improvising cellist, seems most allied with the violin tradition in black America. Especially since the 1960's, jazz violinists have embodied a strangely ancient, Gypsy-influenced sensibility. Ms. Murray also bears this stamp, and it doesn't make her a classical-jazz traditionalist; she leans toward earlier, folkier sources. In her work with 1980's experimentalists like Fred Hopkins, Hannibal Peterson, Henry Threadgill and others, there has always been a pre-20th-century air blowing through the music.

title: Whose Heaven Is It?
description: Is acceptance of Jesus Christ necessary for salvation? That is the question threatening to split the Dutch Reformed Church in America, which has about 200,000 members. The Rev. Richard A. Rhem, pastor of Christ Community Church in Spring Lake, Mich., has said he no longer believes that Jesus is the only route to God. Through their own religions, he argues, Jews, Muslims and Buddhists can be admitted to heaven.

title: Justice Department Breaks Merger News
description: The Justice Department broke the news today that the Westinghouse Air Brake Company was planning to buy the Vapor Corporation when it gave its approval to the yet-to-be-announced acquisition.

title: Dole Promises Energy Department Cuts Won't Shut New Mexico Laboratories
description: Bob Dole reassured voters here today that despite having previously urged abolishing the Energy Department, he would preserve the national defense laboratories in New Mexico.

title: Who Can Defend Ads For Young Smokers?
description: To the Editor:
